pony.Priority<T>

This class help you build priority list. Example: 
  var p:Priority<Int> = new Priority<Int>();
  p.add(123);
  p.add(22, -1);
  p.toString();//[22, 123], 22 - first
authors
AxGord
type
class


Constructor

new(?e : T, ?ea : Array<T>)

Instance Variables

array(getArray,setArray) : Array<T>

double : Bool

if true: [1, 1, 3] - normal. Default false.

first(getFirst,null) : T

First element.

last(getLast,null) : T

Last element.

length(getLenght,null) : Int

Total elements count.

list(getList,setList) : List<T>

max(getMax,null) : Int

Hightest priority number.

min(getMin,null) : Int

Lowest priority number.

Instance Methods

add(ao : Dynamic, ?priority : Int) : Void

Add element in priority list with custom priority.
parameters
oa Object for adding in list or objects array. Type T or Array<T>. I'm write Dynamic for flash platform. ?a:T - fail :(
priority priority, smalest first, bigest last, default 0 (0 - normal priority).

addArray(a : Array<T>, ?priority : Int) : Void

Add elements array in priority list with custom priority.
parameters
a elements array for adding.
priority priority, smalest first, bigest last, default 0 (0 - normal priority).

addElement(o : T, ?priority : Int) : Void

addToBegin(o : Dynamic) : Void

Add element with lowest priority.
parameters
o T or Array<T>.

addToEnd(o : Dynamic) : Void

Add element with hightest priority.
parameters
o T or Array<T>.

change(o : Dynamic, ?priority : Int) : Void

Change new prioriy for element.
parameters
o T or Array<T> or T->Bool
priority New priority, default 0

clear() : Void

Remove all elements

empty() : Bool

exists(of : Dynamic) : Bool

If argument T->Bool, function take first argument tested element and returt true for say: Search end, element exists.
Example:
      p.exists(function(a:Int):Bool return a == 3);
Also you can use Array
parameters
of T or T->Bool or Array<T> or Array<T->Bool>
returns
Return true if element exists, false if not exists.

iterator() : Iterator<T>

Example: 
      var sum:Int = 0;
      for (e in p)
          sum += e;
      sum; //145
Elements begining with lowest priority, ending higtest.
This funcion not crashed if you make operations with Priority object. You can remove and add elements in "for" body.

loop() : T

Make infinity loop. This good metod for devolopment UI.
returns
Next element in loop

remove(oa : Dynamic) : Void

parameters
oa T or Array<T> or T->Bool

repriority(?priority : Int) : Void

All elements taking new priority, but save order.
parameters
priority New priority, default 0

resetLoop() : Void

Next time loop return first element.

search(f : T -> Bool) : T

Some time need take object with custom value.

toString() : String
